summary: In 2017, a series of high profile and destructive disasters—Hurricanes Harvey, Irma, and Maria, and wildfires in California—affected nearly 47 million people (about 15% of the U.S. population). As of June 30, 2018, the Federal Emergency Management Agency had entered into contracts worth almost $4.5 billion in response to these disasters. We testified about key challenges FEMA faced in contracting for goods and services for...
title: Disaster Contracting: FEMA Continues to Face Challenges with Its Use of Contracts to Support Response and Recovery
